feed.title: Google Cloud: Network Security Integration
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Network Security Integration

entry.content: You can now integrate your network security appliances directly in the network traffic path for inspection and identify any threats before the traffic reaches its destination. For more information, see In-band integration overview. This feature is available in General Availability.
entry.summary: You can now integrate your network security appliances directly in the network traffic path for inspection and identify any threats before the traffic reaches its destination. This feature is available in General Availability.
entry.title: Feature: Integrate network security appliances

entry.content: Network Security integration now retains 396 bytes for the GENEVE encapsulation overhead. Consumer networks must use the maximum transmission unit (MTU) size of 8500 bytes or less. Producer networks must use an MTU at least 396 bytes more than the consumer network. For more information, see GENEVE encapsulation and MTU requirements.
entry.summary: The GENEVE encapsulation overhead has been updated to 396 bytes. Ensure your network's MTU is set appropriately to avoid issues. Consumer networks should use an MTU of 8500 bytes or less, while producer networks need an MTU at least 396 bytes larger than the consumer network's MTU.
entry.title: Changed: Network Security: GENEVE Encapsulation Overhead Update
